results.title: Motor mechanic
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Designed to give the intending mechanic some idea of the specialised work involved in the career of a modern automotive mechanic. The technical training required is discussed.

results.title: Motor mania (K)
results.creator_credit: Jack Kinney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A Disney animated film about road safety and the change that takes place in an average individual when they sit behind the wheel of a car. The pleasant, courteous Mr Walker becomes the fiendish Mr Wheeler, forgetting how it feels to be a pedestrian and stubbornly blind to his failings as a driver.
results.description: A Disney animated film about road safety and the change that takes place in an average individual when they sit behind the wheel of a car. The pleasant, courteous Mr Walker becomes the fiendish Mr Wheeler, forgetting how it feels to be a pedestrian and stubbornly blind to his failings as a driver.

results.title: Motivation: the classic concepts (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: Presents five classic work motivation theories: McGregor’s Theory X and Theory Y, Maslow’s need hierarchy, Hertzberg’s “hygiene’s” and “motivators”, McClellands motivational profiles and Skinner’s behaviour reinforcement. Illustrates that humans are motivated by a complex set of factors including money, the need for achievement and the desire for meaningful work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
results.description: Presents five classic work motivation theories: McGregor’s Theory X and Theory Y, Maslow’s need hierarchy, Hertzberg’s “hygiene’s” and “motivators”, McClellands motivational profiles and Skinner’s behaviour reinforcement. Illustrates that humans are motivated by a complex set of factors including money, the need for achievement and the desire for meaningful work.

Illustrates that humans are motivated by a complex set of factors including money, the need for achievement and the desire for meaningful work.

results.title: Motivation through job enrichment (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William C. Jersey, Howard Enders, Quest and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gellerman Motivation and Productivity Film”.
Discusses Herzberg’s “motivation hygiene” theory. Good pay, security, friendly supervision do not usually motivate people as well as job enrichment.

results.title: Motivation in perspective
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Saul Gellerman summarises theories of several experts concerning management and notes that the theme of each of these theories is that employees are not being used at their full capacity. Shows how the theories of each expert reinforce the theories of the others.
results.description: SUMMARY: Saul Gellerman summarises theories of several experts concerning management and notes that the theme of each of these theories is that employees are not being used at their full capacity. Shows how the theories of each expert reinforce the theories of the others.

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Motivation and reward in learning
results.creator_credit: Gardner Hart, Neal E. Miller and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.brief_description: Records experimental demonstrations with white rats to illustrate the importance of motivation and reward in learning. Compares a hungry, active rat with a saitated, inactive rat. The hungry animal learns to get food by pressing a bar, while the satiated animal goes to sleep. To demonstrate that failure to learn is due to lack of motivation, a mild electric shock is supplied and the satiated animal becomes active and learns to strike a lever which turns off the shock. Shows the animal also learning to rotate a wheel, bite a rubber tube, and strike another animal to avoid electric shock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gardner Hart, Neal E. Miller and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.description: Records experimental demonstrations with white rats to illustrate the importance of motivation and reward in learning. results.title: Motivation and emotion
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Motivation is the general term for all the physical and psychological processes that start behaviour, maintain it and stop it. What motivates people to do good … or evil? Psychology professor, Philip Zimbardo, of Stanford University, discusses why we act and feel as we do, exploring the biological and sociological aspects of motivation and its relation to our emotions, as well as the constant tension existing between desire and restraint, particularly in relation to sexual attraction.
